name: Old Street (Cassandra Old Street)
description: Old Street is one of the oldest surviving streets in Cassandra, lined with aging buildings and remnants of the town’s earlier prosperity. Compared to newer streets, it feels worn, heavy with history, and slightly neglected, reflecting Cassandra’s long-standing decay beneath a familiar surface.

snapshot.name: Old Street
snapshot.description: Old Street runs through a quieter, more timeworn part of town. The architecture is outdated, with cracked walls, faded signage, and a general sense that time has slowed here. Few people linger for long. The street hosts several notable but aging locations, each tied to Cassandra’s past rather than its present.

characters.name: Shandra Hernández
characters.notes: Shandra lives alone in a small cabin on Old Street. She keeps to herself and rarely draws attention, blending into the street’s forgotten atmosphere.

conditions.description: Lighting is dim, especially at dusk and night, with weak streetlamps and long shadows.
The street is quiet, interrupted only by distant industrial noises or creaking structures.

exits.description: An old clock shop with a traditional display window, its mechanisms and ticking sounds echoing the passage of time.
An aging distillery occupying a larger structure along Old Street, a reminder of Cassandra’s former industry.
A small, modest cabin tucked slightly away from the main road, serving as Shandra Hernández’s residence.

snapshot.keeperNotes: Old Street should feel heavy with history and decline. Emphasize contrast between its past importance and its current stagnation, making it ideal for slow-burn discoveries rather than overt action.

connections.description: Old Street provides access to the clock shop, a location tied to the town’s older residents and secrets.
The distillery is directly accessible from Old Street and represents Cassandra’s industrial past.
Shandra’s cabin branches off Old Street and serves as her primary residence.
